result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua D Juergens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua D Juergens is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua D Juergens was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Joshua D Juergens was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
